title: The Da Vinci Code
description:
While in Paris on business, Harvard symbologist Robert Langdon receives an urgent late-night phone call: the elderly curator of the Louvre has been murdered inside the museum. Near the body, police have found a baffling cipher. Solving the enigmatic riddle, Langdon is stunned to discover it leads to a trail of clues hidden in the works of Da VinciÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¦clues visible for all to seeÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¦and yet ingeniously disguised by the painter.

Langdon joins forces with a gifted French cryptologist, Sophie Neveu, and learns the late curator was involved in the Priory of SionÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½an actual secret society whose members included Sir Isaac Newton, Botticelli, Victor Hugo, and Da Vinci, among others. The Louvre curator has sacrificed his life to protect the Priory&#039;s most sacred trust: the location of a vastly important religious relic, hidden for centuries.

In a breathless race through Paris, London, and beyond, Langdon and Neveu match wits with a faceless powerbroker who appears to work for Opus DeiÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½a clandestine, Vatican-sanctioned Catholic sect believed to have long plotted to seize the Priory&#039;s secret. Unless Langdon and Neveu can decipher the labyrinthine puzzle in time, the Priory&#039;s secretÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½and a stunning historical truthÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½will be lost forever.

In an exhilarating blend of relentless adventure, scholarly intrigue, and cutting wit, symbologist Robert Langdon (first introduced in Dan Brown&#039;s bestselling Angels & Demons) is the most original character to appear in years. THE DA VINCI CODE heralds the arrival of a new breed of lightening-paced, intelligent thrillerÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¦surprising at every twist, absorbing at every turn, and in the end, utterly unpredictableÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¦right up to its astonishing conclusion.
